intro: Steganthus lanceus, commonly known as the lanceleaf steganthus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers, which range in color from pink to violet, bloom in summer and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Steganthus lanceus is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
